com.bigdata.rdf.internal

Interface ILexiconConfiguration<V extends BigdataValue>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    LexiconConfiguration

    public interface ILexiconConfiguration<V extends BigdataValue>
    Configuration determines which RDF Values are inlined into the statement indices rather than being assigned term identifiers by the lexicon.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      V asValue(LiteralExtensionIV<?> iv)
      Create an RDF value from an AbstractInlineExtensionIV.
      V asValueFromVocab(IV<?,?> iv)

      IV createInlineIV(org.openrdf.model.Value value)
      Create an inline IV for the supplied RDF value if inlining is supported for the supplied RDF value.
      int getBlobsThreshold()
      Return the threshold at which a literal would be stored in the LexiconKeyOrder.BLOBS index.
      String getGeoSpatialConfig()
      Return the configuration string for the GeoSpatial service
      TimeZone getInlineDateTimesTimeZone()
      Return the default time zone to be used for inlining.

    • Method Detail

      • getMaxInlineStringLength

        int getMaxInlineStringLength()
        Return the maximum length of a Unicode string which may be inlined into the statement indices. This applies to blank node IDs, literal labels (including the XSDStringExtension), local names of URIs, etc.
        See Also:
        AbstractTripleStore.Options#MAX_INLINE_TEXT_LENGTH

      • isInlineTextLiterals

        boolean isInlineTextLiterals()
        See Also:
        AbstractTripleStore.Options#INLINE_TEXT_LITERALS

      • isInlineLiterals

        boolean isInlineLiterals()
        Return true if datatype literals are being inlined into the statement indices.

      • isInlineDateTimes

        boolean isInlineDateTimes()
        Return true if xsd:datetime literals are being inlined into the statement indices.

      • isGeoSpatial

        boolean isGeoSpatial()
        Return true if GeoSpatial support is enabled.

      • getGeoSpatialConfig

        String getGeoSpatialConfig()
        Return the configuration string for the GeoSpatial service

      • getInlineDateTimesTimeZone

        TimeZone getInlineDateTimesTimeZone()
        Return the default time zone to be used for inlining.

      • getBlobsThreshold

        int getBlobsThreshold()
        Return the threshold at which a literal would be stored in the LexiconKeyOrder.BLOBS index.
        See Also:
        AbstractTripleStore.Options#BLOBS_THRESHOLD

      • isBlobsDisabled

        boolean isBlobsDisabled()
        Return true iff the BLOBS index has been disabled.
        See Also:
        Disable BLOBS indexing completely for GPU

      • createInlineIV

        IV createInlineIV(org.openrdf.model.Value value)
        Create an inline IV for the supplied RDF value if inlining is supported for the supplied RDF value.

        Note: If the supplied RDF value is a BigdataValue then the IV will be set as a side-effect and will be available from BigdataValue.getIV().

        Parameters:
        value - The RDF value
        Returns:
        The inline IV -or- null if the Value can not be represented by an IV.

      • getInlineURILocalNameFromDelegate

        String getInlineURILocalNameFromDelegate(org.openrdf.model.URI namespace,
                                         AbstractLiteralIV<BigdataLiteral,?> delegate)
        Inflate the localName portion of an inline URI using its storage delegate.
        Parameters:
        namespace - the uris's prefix
        delegate - the storage delegate
        Returns:
        the inflated localName

      • asValue

        V asValue(LiteralExtensionIV<?> iv)
        Create an RDF value from an AbstractInlineExtensionIV. The "extension" IV MUST be registered with the Vocabulary.

        For LiteralExtensionIV, this through an internal catalog of IExtensions to find one that knows how to handle the extension datatype from the supplied LiteralExtensionIV. This is the historical use case.

        Parameters:
        iv - the extension IV
        Returns:
        The RDF Value

      • asValueFromVocab

        V asValueFromVocab(IV<?,?> iv)
        Return the Value for that IV iff the IV is declared in the Vocabulary.
        Parameters:
        iv - The IV.
        Returns:
        The Value -or- null if the IV was not declared in the Vocabulary.

      • initExtensions

        void initExtensions(IDatatypeURIResolver resolver)
        Initialize the extensions, which need to resolve their datatype URIs into term ids.

      • getValueFactory

        BigdataValueFactory getValueFactory()
        Return the value factory for the lexicon.

      • isInlineDatatypeToTextIndex

        boolean isInlineDatatypeToTextIndex(org.openrdf.model.URI datatype)
        Should the specified datatype be included in the text index (even though it is an inline datatype, for example IPv4).

      • getTypeHandlers

        Iterable<IMathOpHandler> getTypeHandlers()
        Get iterator over registered type handlers.
